articles.title: DPRK FM Spokesman Denounces U.S. for Mulling Staging Provocative Naval Maneuver
articles.content:
DPRK FM Spokesman Denounces U.S. for Mulling Staging Provocative Naval Maneuver 
Pyongyang, October 22 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Foreign Ministry of the DPRK Thursday gave the following answer to the question raised by KCNA as regards the U.S. moves to disturb the security and escalate tension on the Korean Peninsula again:
					As already known, the U.S. is mulling staging a large joint naval maneuver with the south Korean navy by hurling the U.S. nuclear-powered carrier Ronald Reagan together with cruiser and Aegis destroyers into the waters off Pusan. 
					
					This is an open challenge to the fair and aboveboard proposal of the DPRK and unanimous desire of the peace-loving people of the world. 
					
					As re-clarified by the DPRK several times, it recently advanced an important proposal for concluding a peace treaty as early as possible to remove the danger of war and create a durable and peaceful environment on the Korean Peninsula under the situation where it is impossible to prevent any clash and defuse the danger of a new war any longer with the existing Armistice Agreement.
					
					Nevertheless, the U.S. is challenging the above-said proposal by introducing the nuclear-powered carrier and other war means into south Korea again. 
					
					The protracted efforts for dialogue for the denuclearization of the peninsula failed because of the U.S. ceaseless nuclear blackmail and nuclear war exercises against the DPRK.
					
					The U.S. is still claiming that denuclearization is priority while aggravating the situation on the peninsula through escalating military provocations. This is a far-fetched assertion and sophism reminiscent of the logic of a highway robber who had no opportunity of getting higher education.
					
					The reality proves that how premature the discussion on the denuclearization of the peninsula was and how urgent the conclusion of a peace treaty between the DPRK and the U.S. is.
					
					If the U.S. desperately clings to its reckless moves for nuclear confrontation while persistently shunning our call for concluding a peace treaty, it will only suffer a bitter failure and regret for it.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Vietnamese Delegation
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Vietnamese Delegation
 Pyongyang, October 22 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, had a talk with a delegation of political officials of the Vietnam People's Army headed by Deputy Head of its General Political Department Nguyen Trong Nghia which paid a courtesy call on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Thursday.
					 Present there were Lieut. General Ryom Chol Song and other generals and officers of the Korean People's Army, ambassador Pham Viet Hung and military attache Le Duy Long of the Vietnamese embassy here.

articles.title: Reunion of Separated Families, Relatives from North and South Goes on
articles.content:
Reunion of Separated Families, Relatives from North and South Goes on
 Mt. Kumgang Resort, October 22 (KCNA) -- The reunion of separated families and relatives from the north and the south is going on at Mt. Kumgang Resort.
					 Those from the north side met their families and relatives from the south several times and shared kindred feelings, having photos taken and having meals together.
					
					 They bid farewell to the families and relatives from the south on Thursday.
					
					 The families and relatives from the north side will meet those from the south side from Saturday.

articles.title: Wreaths Laid before Grave of Yon Hyong Muk
articles.content:
Wreaths Laid before Grave of Yon Hyong Muk
 Pyongyang, October 22 (KCNA) -- Wreaths were laid before the grave of patriotic martyr Yon Hyong Muk at the Patriotic Martyrs Cemetery in Sinmi-ri on the occasion of the 10th anniversary of his death.
					 A wreath sent by Marshal Kim Jong Un was laid before his grave.
					
					 Present at the wreath-laying ceremony were Vice-Premier Kim Yong Jin, Kim Jong Im, director of the Party History Institute of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK), officials of the party and armed forces organs, the Cabinet and national institutions and bereaved families.
					
					 Wreaths in the names of the WPK Central Committee, the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, the Cabinet, the General Political Bureau of the Korean People's Army and the Grand People's Study House and bunches of flowers were laid before the grave.
					
					 The participants observed a moment's silence in memory of Yon Hyong Muk.

articles.title: Ceremony of Kindling Torch of 6th Int'l Martial Arts Games Held
articles.content:
Ceremony of Kindling Torch of 6th Int'l Martial Arts Games Held
 Pyongyang, October 22 (KCNA) -- A ceremony of kindling the torch of the 6th International Martial Arts Games took place here Thursday.
					 The torch kindled at the flame holder of the games in Chongchun Street will kindle the flame holder of the opening ceremony of the 6th International Martial Games to be held in India in December this year.
					
					 Present there were Kim Myong Gun, representative of the International Martial Arts Games Committee, Ri Yong Son, president of the International Taekwon-Do Federation, Kim Kyong Ho, chairman of the Korean Taekwon-Do Committee, officials concerned, martial arts players, working people and school youth and children in the city.
					
					 Present there were Rajendran Balan, president of the Indian National Martial Art Games Federation who doubles as chairman of the organizing committee of the 6th International Martial Arts Games, Paul G. Hoglund, first vice-president of the World Judo Federation, Low Thiow Tong, representative of the Australia National Martial Art Games Committee, Li Zonglin, chief director of the International Martial Art Fund, foreign diplomatic envoys here, officials concerned of martial arts of different countries.
					
					 Speakers said that the games will mark an important occasion in boosting the unity and cooperation among martial arts organizations of different countries of the world.
					
					 Kim Myong Gun handed torchlight to be sent to the games to torch holders.
					
					 They ran along Chongchun Street, holding the torchlight.

articles.title: WHO Southeast Asia Regional Workshop on Traditional Medicine Held
articles.content:
WHO Southeast Asia Regional Workshop on Traditional Medicine Held
 Pyongyang, October 22 (KCNA) -- The WHO Southeast Asia Regional Workshop on Traditional Medicine took place here on Oct. 20 and 21.
					 Present there were Kang Ha Guk, minister of Public Health, officials in the public health field, Poonam Khetrapal Singh, director of the Regional Office for Southeast Asia of the WHO, Representative Stephan Paul Jost and members of the WHO in the DPRK and delegations of Nepal, Bhutan, Sri Lanka, Thailand, India and other countries.
					
					 Presented at the workshop were successes and experience gained by countries in Southeast Asia in developing traditional medicine.
					
					 Speakers underlined the need to integrate traditional medicine into the state healthcare system and combine education in traditional medicine with education in modern medicine.
					
					 They also stressed the need for regional countries to positively conduct the work for integrating traditional medicine into the state healthcare system.

articles.title: Pyongyang Medical Science Symposium on Neurosurgery Held
articles.content:
Pyongyang Medical Science Symposium on Neurosurgery Held
 Pyongyang, October 22 (KCNA) -- The Pyongyang medical science symposium on neurosurgery took place on Wednesday and Thursday.
					 Present there were Ri Hyok, vice-chairman of the Central Committee of the Medical Association of Korea, officials, doctors, researchers and teachers in the field of public health, experts on neurosurgery of different countries and overseas Korean medical scientists.
					
					 Ro Yong Han, chairman of the Neurosurgery Committee of the Medical Association of Korea, made an opening address to be followed by congratulatory speeches.
					
					 The participants heard a series of valuable papers.
					
					 Speakers explained the theoretical and practical issues arising in neurosurgery development and advanced research achievements and experience gained in the course of introducing latest science and technology into clinical practice.

articles.title: National Sci-tech Presentation in Field of Beauty Culture Held
articles.content:
National Sci-tech Presentation in Field of Beauty Culture Held
 Pyongyang, October 22 (KCNA) -- A national scientific and technological presentation in the field of beauty culture was held here from Oct. 20 to 22.
					 The presentation was held under the sponsorship of the Central Committee of the General Federation of Science and Technology of Korea. 
					
					 Present there were officials of the Korean Association of Beauty Cultured Technology, teachers and researchers in the field of beauty culture and welfare service workers from across the country.
					
					 It heard papers of great value introducing achievements and experience gained in improving the quality of beauty culture service as required by the era and taste of the people building a highly civilized socialist nation.
					
					 A series of papers were appreciated by the participants.
					
					 There took place beauty culture and haircut contests.

articles.title: 2015 Inter-provincial Mass Sports Contest Opens in DPRK
articles.content:
2015 Inter-provincial Mass Sports Contest Opens in DPRK
 Pyongyang, October 22 (KCNA) -- The 2015 Inter-provincial Mass Sports Contest opened with due ceremony at the Pyongyang Indoor Stadium on Thursday.
					 Present at the ceremony were Choe Ryong Hae, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea who doubles as chairman of the State Physical Culture and Sports Guidance Commission and, Vice-Premier Ro Tu Chol, chairman of the State Planning Commission who doubles as vice-chairman of the State Physical Culture and Sports Guidance Commission, and Kim Yong Hun, minister of Physical Culture and Sports, officials concerned, provincial (municipal) players and cheer squads, and working people, youths and students in Pyongyang.
					
					 Choe Ryong Hae in an opening address said the contest would be the one for glorifying for all ages the undying exploits performed by President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il for the mass sports of the country and for demonstrating the faith and will of the sportspersons and other Korean people to materialize the idea and intention of the Party to put the country on the status of a sports powerhouse as early as possible.
					
					 There was a march-past of the players to be followed by a men's basketball match between the Jagang and South Hwanghae provincial teams.

articles.title: Vietnamese Delegation Visits Mangyongdae
articles.content:
Vietnamese Delegation Visits Mangyongdae
 Pyongyang, October 22 (KCNA) -- A delegation of political officials of the Vietnam People's Army headed by Deputy Head of its General Political Department Nguyen Trong Nghia visited Mangyongdae, the birthplace of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Members of the delegation looked round the historic relics preserved with much care at the old home in Mangyongdae, being briefed on the revolutionary history of the President and his patriotic and revolutionary family members in Mangyongdae.
					
					 They toured the revolutionary relics on Mangyong Hill.
					
					 They also visited the Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum, the Tower of the Juche Idea, the Korean People's Army Museum of Weapons and Equipment, Panmunjom, etc.

articles.title: Foreign Guests Pay Tribute to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Foreign Guests Pay Tribute to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, October 22 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the New Socialist Party of Japan led by Secretary General of its Central Headquarters Hirokuni Osanami and other foreign guests visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun on Thursday.
					 The guests paid tribute to President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il before their statues at the palace.
					
					 In the halls where they lie in state the guests paid homage to them.
					
					 They went round the halls in which orders the great leaders received are on display and halls which house cars, electric car, boat and train coaches used by them during their field guidance and foreign tours till the last moments of their lives.

articles.title: Cuban Diplomats Help Korean Farmers
articles.content:
Cuban Diplomats Help Korean Farmers
 Pyongyang, October 22 (KCNA) -- Ambassador German Hermin Ferras Alvarez and staff members of the Cuban embassy here did friendship labor at the DPRK-Cuba Friendship Hwasong Greenhouse Vegetable Farm on Thursday.
					 After going round the room dedicated to the history of the farm associated with the leadership feats of President Kim Il Sung, the staff members helped the farmers in threshing rice.
					
					 During a break they had a talk with officials of the farm.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Birthday Spread to Centenarian
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Birthday Spread to Centenarian
 Chonnae, October 22 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un sent a birthday spread to Pak Kil Nyo, a woman centenarian living in People's Neighborhood Unit No. 83 of Ryongdam Workers' District, Chonnae County of Kangwon Province.
					 Born in Tapchon-ri, Munchon City on October 20, Juche 4 (1915), she experienced the bitter sorrow over being stateless woman, subject to humiliation and maltreatment under the colonial rule of the Japanese imperialists.
					
					 She could lead a worthwhile life only after the country was liberated by President Kim Il Sung. She sincerely helped service personnel on the front during the Fatherland Liberation War and devoted herself to increasing agricultural production to repay the benevolence of the Party and the leader.
					
					 Always keeping herself optimistic, she has balanced diet.

articles.title: Wangjaesan Revolutionary Site
articles.content:
Wangjaesan Revolutionary Site
 Pyongyang, October 22 (KCNA) -- The Wangjaesan Revolutionary Site is located in Onsong County, North Hamgyong Province of the DPRK.
					 The revolutionary site was built in October Juche 64 (1975), the 30th anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea, under the guidance of leader Kim Jong Il in order to convey the feats performed by President Kim Il Sung during the anti-Japanese armed struggle.
					
					 In March 11, 1933, Kim Il Sung led a unit of the Korean People's Revolutionary Army to climb Mt. Wangjae after crossing the tightly-guarded border River Tuman. There he convened a meeting of chiefs of underground revolutionary organizations and political workers in the Onsong Area, at which he delivered a speech "To Spread and Develop the Armed Struggle into the Homeland".
					
					 The site is a sacred place of the Korean revolution where Kim Il Sung laid down a strategic line on expanding the anti-Japanese armed struggle into the homeland and aroused all Koreans to the victory in the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle.

articles.title: Construction Projects Progress Apace in DPRK
articles.content:
Construction Projects Progress Apace in DPRK
 Pyongyang, October 22 (KCNA) -- Construction projects go on apace in different parts of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea with the 70th anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea (Oct. 10) as an occasion.
					 In Hamhung City, South Hamgyong Province, big efforts have been directed to completing such projects in a short period as construction of three blocks of apartment houses for scientists, 4-D simulation cinema and baby home and orphanage and renovation of the Majon Resort.
					
					 In Kaesong City the reconstruction of department store goes on at the final stage while the inhabitants in Wonsan City, Kangwon Province work hard to finish the project for gravity-fed waterworks.
					
					 Besides, the construction of apartment and dwelling houses is brisk in various parts of Sunchon City, South Phyongan Province.

articles.title: Distinguished Woman Runner of DPRK
articles.content:
Distinguished Woman Runner of DPRK
 Pyongyang, October 22 (KCNA) -- Kim Son Hui, a woman runner of the Chongchongang Sports Team in the DPRK, rose to fame for having won four gold medals in two international games this year.
					 Kim came first in the 1 500m and 5,000m races of the 2015 Chinese Taipei Track and Field Tournament in May and in the 5,000m and 10,000m races of the 2015 Vietnam International Track and Field Tournament in August.
					
					 She also took the first place in the 1,500m and 5,000m races of the Mangyongdae Prize Sports Games held here in April.
					
					 She began training running at the age of nine.
					
					 She is now a domestic champion in the 5,000m and 10,000m races.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Blasts S. Korean Authorities' Moves for Introduction of "State-compiled Textbooks"
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Blasts S. Korean Authorities' Moves for Introduction of "State-compiled Textbooks"
 Pyongyang, October 22 (KCNA) -- The south Korean authorities made public the "system of introducing state-compiled textbooks" for teaching history to the students of the middle and high schools.
					 This is aimed to instill reactionary view on history and value into the rising generations in a sinister bid to turn the south Korean society into the one dominated by the "Saenuri Party" and other ultra-right conservative forces and keep escalating criminal confrontation with fellow countrymen and ensure longer stay in power based on it.
					
					 The above-said system was enforced for a considerable time during the Park Chung-hee regime. This was abused for justifying the ruling conservative forces' pro-Japanese and pro-U.S. dictatorship and inciting confrontation with the fellow countrymen.
					
					 The struggle of south Koreans from all walks of life resulted in replacing the system by "the system of screening textbooks" in 2003. But the conservative authorities are making desperate efforts to retrieve the antiquated system from the dumping ground of history.
					
					 The announcement of the controversial system set the stage for adding pages embellishing the past dictatorial era and justifying the moves for confrontation with the fellow countrymen to the history textbooks for middle and high school students.
					
					 This is attributable to the south Korean authorities who are working hard to revive the "yusin" dictatorship, drive the livelihood of people into dire destitution and achieve "unification through absorption" after labeling the fellow countrymen in the north as enemy.
					
					 As a matter of fact, the south Korean authorities have been forsaken by the people for their crimes committed against the nation.
					
					 The daily-mounting anti-"government" struggle of the south Koreans casts dark shadow over the ruling quarters' ambition for a longer stay in power and their confrontation moves.
					
					 Much upset by this, they crafted the above-said system in order to attain their sinister purpose at any cost.
					
					 They claimed that the system is meant for the unity of the people. But this trumpeting only brought to light their ulterior motive to imbue the rising generation with the consciousness of confrontation with the fellow countrymen and fan up extreme hatred for those struggling for justice and progress in a bid to build their support base and realize their ambition for a longer stay in power and "unification through absorption."
					
					 Their moves for enforcing the above-said system are a hideous act of treachery as they are designed to bring the south Korean society back to the dark era and scuttle the efforts for the improvement of the north-south ties.
					
					 South Korean academic, educational and media circles and lots of civic and public organizations have turned out in the actions against the system.
					
					 Those who go against the history and mindset are bound to face miserable self-destruction.
					
					 The south Korean authorities have to face up to the reality and immediately stop the moves.

articles.title: No Country Is So Shameless as Japan: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
No Country Is So Shameless as Japan: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, October 22 (KCNA) -- Not long ago, China applied to the UNESCO for having facts about the Nanjing Massacre perpetrated by the Imperial Japanese Army registered as a world heritage.
					 The UNESCO carefully examined the application and decided to register them as a world heritage, concluding that they are in full line with the standard for assessment and examination.
					
					 Rodong Sinmun in a commentary Thursday observes in this regard: 
					
					 It is a stark historical fact that the Imperial Japanese Army committed unheard-of crimes against humanity by cruelly killing people of Asian countries in the past.
					
					 It is ethics, morality, legal requirement and practice for a criminal to feel guilty and apologize for it.
					
					 However, Japan is still behaving quite contrary to them.
					
					 It is making far-fetched assertions that there is no experts' verification of whether the facts on the massacre are true or not.
					
					 What is stunning is that it is challenging the UNESCO with a threat to cut down its contribution, grumbling that the organization does favor only for China, though Japan is "cooperating" with it through huge financial contribution.
					
					 There are not a few countries and nations in the world which committed wrongs but no country is as imprudent as Japan.
					
					 Japan is sadly mistaken. With no far-fetched assertion can it write off historical facts.
					
					 Japan would be well advised to bear this in mind and admit its crimes and opt for redressing them, though belatedly.

articles.title: History Textbooks Embellishing "Yusin" Dictatorship under Fire
articles.content:
History Textbooks Embellishing "Yusin" Dictatorship under Fire
 Pyongyang, October 22 (KCNA) -- South Korean CBS on Oct. 16 claimed that the system of introducing "state-compiled" history textbooks pushed forward by the authorities is aimed to embellish the "yusin" dictatorship.
					 The trial "state-compiled history textbooks" for the fifth grade pupils of some primary schools neither describe Park Chung-Hee's "yusin regime" as dictatorship even once nor mention pro-Japanese traitors, the broadcasting service disclosed, and went on:
					
					 The "prime minister" on Oct. 14 said even though the history textbooks for secondary and high school students are compiled by the state, they can be no textbooks praising "yusin".
					
					 However, the present textbooks reflect the beautification of the "yusin" dictatorship and pro-Japanese view on history.
					
					 The present "government" and the "Saenuri Party" assert that screened history textbooks are ideologically biased, but opposition will grow stronger to the "state-compiled textbooks" as they openly embellish the "yusin" system, the broadcasting service held.

articles.title: S. Korean Students Protest against Japan's Moves for Reinvasion
articles.content:
S. Korean Students Protest against Japan's Moves for Reinvasion
 Pyongyang, October 22 (KCNA) -- Students affiliated to the Peace Butterfly Network of south Korea staged a surprise demo in Seoul on Oct. 19 demanding the settlement of the issue of the sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army and stop to Japan's moves for reinvasion.
					 They censured the Japanese Defense Minister's visit to south Korea to hold defense ministerial talks, declaring that for him to visit south Korea without giving a fundamental solution to the issue of the sexual slavery was a problem.
					
					 They held that the visit is to boost military cooperation including the conclusion of an agreement on protecting military information with south Korea.
					
					 They staged a demo chanting slogans urging Japan to settle the issue of the sexual slavery and drop the dream of staging a comeback to the Korean Peninsula.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Benin
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Benin
 Pyongyang, October 22 (KCNA) -- A Beninese national committee for remembering General Kim Jong Il was inaugurated in Cotonou on Oct. 15.
					 Hessou Kohovi, chairman of the Benin National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea and chairman of the Benin-Korea Amicable Association "Long Live Kim Jong Il, Supreme Leader", was elected chairman of the remembrance committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize political and cultural events for giving wide publicity to his noble revolutionary career and immortal feats.

articles.title: WPK's Birthday Celebrated in Different Countries
articles.content:
WPK's Birthday Celebrated in Different Countries
Pyongyang, October 22 (KCNA) -- Events took place in different countries on the occasion of the 70th anniversary of the founding of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK).
					They included meetings, book and photo exhibitions and film shows in Nigeria, Sweden and Finland from October 6 to 8.
					
					 Displayed at the venues of the events were photos documenting the exploits President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un performed by building and leading the WPK.
					
					Also on display there were books and photos introducing the achievements made by the service personnel and people in the DPRK in building a thriving socialist country.
					
					Korean films were screened at the film shows.
					
					Alhassan Mamman Muhammad, chairman of the Nigerian National Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, said that the WPK led the Korean people to victory as the guiding force of the Korean society for the past 70 years. He went on:
					
					The exploits Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il performed in party building and activities are shedding their rays thanks to Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the WPK.
					
					Christer Lundgren, chairman of the Sweden-Korea Friendship Association, praised the WPK as an invincible revolutionary party which is taking its root deep into the working people and enforcing the unique politics on the basis of rich experience.
					
					Antti Sika Aho, chairman of the Finland-Korea Society, expressed his will to conduct a more positive movement for supporting the just struggle of the WPK and the Korean people.
					
					Congratulatory messages to Kim Jong Un were adopted at the events.

articles.title: WPK Praised by Political Parties of Russia, Brazil
articles.content:
WPK Praised by Political Parties of Russia, Brazil
 Pyongyang, October 22 (KCNA) -- Russian and Brazilian political parities posted special articles on their websites on October 4 and 10 to mark the 70th founding anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK). 
					 The Khabarovsk Territorial Committee of the Communist Party of the Russian Federation posted an article titled "Ever-victorious WPK" accompanied with the portraits of smiling President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The article said the WPK, organizer and guide of all victories of the Korean people, was founded on October 10, 1945. 
					
					 It went on:
					
					 The WPK has achieved steel-strong unity and cohesion. 
					
					 It is enjoying absolute support and trust from the people. 
					
					 It is by no means accidental that the Korean people call the WPK the mother, full of faith and will to share the destiny with it to the last. 
					
					 The Brazilian Marxist-Leninist Communist Party posted an article introducing the invincible might of the WPK. 
					
					 The article said the key to the invincibility of the WPK lies in the great guiding idea, steel-strong unity and cohesion and absolute support of the popular masses.

articles.title: WPK's Birthday Marked at DPRK Missions Abroad
articles.content:
WPK's Birthday Marked at DPRK Missions Abroad 
 Pyongyang, October 22 (KCNA) -- Meetings, seminars, book and photo exhibitions, film shows and receptions were held at the DPRK missions in China, Laos, India, Cambodia, Uzbekistan, Germany, Bulgaria, Switzerland, Spain, Equatorial Guinea, Algeria, Angola, Ethiopia and Peru and the DPRK permanent mission in the UN Office and international organizations in Geneva from October 5 to 9 to mark the 70th founding anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK). 
					 On display at the venues of the events were photos documenting the undying exploits of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 Also on display were their works, and books and photos introducing the victorious and glorious course covered by the WPK.
					
					 Korean films were screened at the film shows. 
					
					 Present at the events on invitation were high-ranking officials, members of organizations for the study of the Juche idea and organizations for friendship and solidarity with the Korean people in the relevant countries and representatives of international organizations. 
					
					 The general secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of India (Marxist) and other personages praised Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il for building the WPK. 
					
					 A vice prime minister in charge of the Royal Palace of Cambodia who is a member of the Presidium of the C.C., the People's Party of Cambodia said he was pleased that everything is going well in the DPRK under the leadership of the WPK headed by Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 The general secretary of the Democratic Workers' Party of Spain said the WPK is a model and beacon of hope of the progressive political parties of the world aspiring after socialism. 
					
					 The chairman of the People's Front of Workers, Peasants and Students of Peru extended full support and solidarity to the just cause of the WPK and the Korean people.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Nigeria
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Nigeria
 Pyongyang, October 22 (KCNA) -- A Nigerian national committee for remembering leader Kim Jong Il was formed in Abuja on Oct. 15.
					 Ibrahim Mantu, member of the Credit Committee of the People's Democratic Party of Nigeria and chairman of the Nigeria-Korea Friendship Association, was elected chairman of the remembrance committee.
					
					 The committee decided to significantly organize remembrance meeting, film show and other political and cultural events praising the noble revolutionary career and immortal exploits of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Anniversary of DIU Formation Observed in Germany, Guinea
articles.content:
Anniversary of DIU Formation Observed in Germany, Guinea
 Pyongyang, October 22 (KCNA) -- A seminar was held in Germany and a lecture in Guinea on Oct. 16 on the occasion of the 89th anniversary of the formation of the Down-with-Imperialism Union (DIU).
					 The chairman of the Anti-Imperialist Forum of Germany said that the DIU formed by President Kim Il Sung on Oct. 17, 1926 was the genuine revolutionary youth organization struggling for the nation's sovereignty and independence.
					
					 The idea and programme of the DIU was successfully carried forward by the WPK founded on Oct. 10, 1945 after the liberation of Korea, he said, adding:
					
					 Celebrations of the 70th founding anniversary of the WPK held with splendor in the presence of Marshal Kim Jong Un are historic events that clearly demonstrated to the world the justness of the idea and leadership of the WPK and the invincibility of Korean-style socialism.
					
					 The DPRK will as ever achieve victory and glory only.
					
					 Secouna Camara, director general of the Kim Il Sung Institute of Agricultural Science in Guinea, noted that the formation of the DIU was a historic event of special significance in carving out the destiny of the Korean people and in the Korean history.

articles.title: WPK Is Invincible Revolutionary Party: Russian Papers
articles.content:
WPK Is Invincible Revolutionary Party: Russian Papers
 Pyongyang, October 22 (KCNA) -- Russian papers edited special write-ups and articles on the occasion of the 18th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's election as general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and the 70th founding anniversary of the WPK.
					 A Khabarovsk Territorial internet paper on Oct. 6 printed an article titled "Flag representing the destiny of the people" illustrated with a photo of Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The paper said:
					
					 President Kim Il Sung made sure that the emblem of the WPK was depicted with a hammer, sickle and writing brush, the symbol of worker, peasant and intellectual, and devoted his whole life to the people.
					
					 The color of the flag of the WPK has not faded away even a bit despite all tests of the history.
					
					  Tribuna on Oct. 8 edited an article praising the WPK that has led the Korean people to victory as the guiding force of the society for the past seven decades, building a prosperous socialist state. 
					
					  The 37th issue of Veteran noted that the WPK is an invincible revolutionary party as it achieved the steel-strong unity and cohesion of the party ranks and enjoys absolute support and trust from the people, guided by Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism.

articles.title: WPK Praised by Congolese Media
articles.content:
WPK Praised by Congolese Media
 Pyongyang, October 22 (KCNA) -- Congolese media carried special write-ups or aired special programs on the occasion of the 70th founding anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK).
					 The paper Le Patriot on Oct. 5 devoted one whole page to an article titled "Seven decades under banner of independence", illustrated with a photo of President Kim Il Sung standing together with leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The paper said:
					
					 The WPK successfully solved all problems arising in the revolution and construction in conformity with the interests of the popular masses and the actual conditions of the country from the very day of its foundation. It has steadily carried forward the role and tradition as the general staff of the Korean revolution, frustrating the vicious moves of the imperialists and working miracles startling the world people under the guidance of Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Another paper on Oct. 6 devoted one whole page to an article titled "The party enjoying absolute support and trust from the people" illustrated with a photo of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The paper stressed that all lines and policies of the WPK reflect all the wishes and interests of the popular masses and all its activities are aimed to meet them.
					
					 The news agency and internet paper Congo-Site. Com on Oct. 1 and 5 in articles illustrated with photos of Kim Jong Un praised the WPK under the titles "It is the supreme principle of the WPK to improve people's living standard" and "Celebration of the 70th founding anniversary of the WPK".

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam se reune con delegacion de funcionarios politicos del EPV
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam se reune con delegacion de funcionarios politicos del EPV
Pyongyang, 22 de octubre (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, departio el dia 22 en el Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae con la delegacion de los funcionarios politicos del Ejercito Popular de Vietnam, presidida por el subjefe del Departamento Politico General, Nguyen Trong Nghia, de visita en la RPDC.
					En la ocasion estuvieron presentes el teniente general de las fuerzas terrestres, Ryom Chol Song y otros generales y oficiales del EPC y el embajador Pham Viet Hung y el agregado militar, Le Duy Long, de la embajada vietnamita en la RPDC.

articles.title: Continua encuentro de familiares y parientes separados de Norte y Sur de Corea
articles.content:
Continua encuentro de familiares y parientes separados de Norte y Sur de Corea
Monte Kumgang, 22 de octubre (ACNC) -- Sigue realizando en el monte Kumgang el encuentro de los familiares y parientes separados del Norte y el Sur de Corea.
					Los habitantes de la parte nortena se reunieron en varias ocasiones con sus familiares y parientes de la parte surena y profundizaron el sentimiento del amor fraternal tomando fotos y comiendo juntos.
					
					El dia 22, nuestros habitantes se despidieron de sus familiares y parientes de la parte surena.
					
					 Se iniciara desde el dia 24 el encuentro de los familiares y parientes de la parte Norte con los de la parte Sur.

articles.title: Depositadas ofrendas florales ante el martir patriotico Yon Hyong Muk
articles.content:
Depositadas ofrendas florales ante el martir patriotico Yon Hyong Muk
Pyongyang, 22 de octubre (ACNC) -- Con motivo del 10o aniversario de fallecimiento del martir patriotico Yon Hyong Muk, fueron depositadas ofrendas florales ante su tumba en el Cementerio de Martires Patrioticos en la comuna Sinmi.
					Estaba colocada ante su tumba una ofrenda floral enviada por el Mariscal Kim Jong Un.
					
					En la ocasion estuvieron presentes el vicepremier Kim Yong Jin, la directora del Instituto de Historia del Partido del CC de PTC, Kim Jong Im, los funcionarios de las instituciones del partido y fuerzas armadas, Consejo de Ministros y organos centrales y los familiares del difunto.
					
					Ante su tumba fueron depositados las ofrendas florales y ramos de flores en nombre del CC del PTC, el Comite de Defensa Nacional de la RPDC, el Consejo de Ministros, la Direccion Politica General del Ejercito Popular de Corea y el Palacio de Estudio del Pueblo.
					
					Los participantes guardaron un momento de silencio en memoria del martir.

articles.title: En Pyongyang ceremonia de coleccion de antorcha para VI Competencia de Artes Marciales
articles.content:
En Pyongyang ceremonia de coleccion de antorcha para VI Competencia de Artes Marciales
Pyongyang, 22 de octubre (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 22 en esta capital la ceremonia de la coleccion de antorcha para la VI Competencia Internacional de Artes Marciales.
					La antorcha escogida en la torre de ahumada de artes marciales en la Avenida Chongchun encendera la torre de antorcha para la ceremonia inaugural de la VI Competencia Internacional de Artes Marciales a efectuarse en diciembre de este ano en la India.
					
					En la ocasion tomaron parte Kim Myong Gun, representante del Comite Internacional de Juegos de Artes Marciales (CIJAM), Ri Yong Son, presidente de la Federacion Internacional de Taekwondo (ITF en ingles), Kim Kyong Ho, presidente del Comite de Taekwondo de Corea, los funcionarios interesados, los taekwondocas y los trabajadores y los jovenes y ninos escolares capitalinos.
					
					Y estuvieron presentes Rajendran Balan, presidente del comite organizativo de CIJAM y presidente de la Confederacion de Juegos de Artes Marciales Nacionales de India, Paul G. Hoglund, primer vicepresidente de la Confederacion Mundial de Judo, Low Thiow Tong, representante del Comite de Juegos de Artes Marciales Nacionales de Australia, Li Zonglin, director general del Fondo Internacional de Artes Marciales, asi como los representantes diplomaticos y los interesados de artes marciales de varios paises en la RPDC.
					
					En la ocasion, los oradores subrayaron que la VI Competencia Internacional de Artes Marciales sera un importante motivo que fortalece la unidad y la cooperacion entre las organizaciones de artes marciales de varios paises del mundo.
					
					Kim Myong Gun entrego la antorcha dirigida a la VI Competencia Internacional de Artes Marciales a los miembros encargados de encender la ahumada.
					
					Estos corrieron con la antorcha encendida a lo largo de la carretera de la Avenida Chongchun.
